name: Litti Chokha
description: The signature dish of Bihar. Whole wheat dough balls stuffed with sattu (roasted gram flour) with tomato-brinjal bharta and smoky saut√©ed potato mash.

name: Silao Khaja
description: A crisp and flaky sweet delicacy from Silao, located between Nalanda and Rajgir. Famous for its delicate sweet layers that melt in the mouth.

name: Sattu Sharbat
description: The signature cooling drink of the region. A savory or sweet drink made from roasted chickpea flour, cumin, lemon, and fresh herbs - perfect for hot summers.

name: Thekua
description: A sweet deep-fried snack made for the Chhath Puja festival. Made from whole wheat flour, jaggery, and desiccated coconut. A festive treasure.

name: Mustard Fish Curry
description: A tangy dish typically made with rohu or catla fish and mustard-based gravy, reflecting the riverine culture of the region.

name: Malpua
description: Soft, fluffy pancakes made from fresh khoya and drenched in sugar syrup. A festive favorite. A festival favorite during Holi.
